item.title: Choosing a CNI Network Provider for Kubernetes
item.description: The Container Network Interface (CNI) is a library definition, and a set of tools under the umbrella of the Cloud Native Computing Foundation project. For more information visit their GitHub project. Kubernetes uses CNI as an interface between network providers and Kubernetes networking. Why Use CNI Kubernetes default networking provider, kubenet, is a simple network plugin that works with various cloud providers. Kubenet is a very basic network provider, and basic is good, but does not have very many features.
